abstract: While all the big banks, with their share prices below book value, are keen on buybacks, regulators are reining them in "because stock repurchases eat into capital," writes David Henry of Reuters.
snippet: While all the big banks, with their share prices below book value, are keen on buybacks, regulators are reining them in "because stock repurchases eat into capital," writes David Henry of Reuters.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase bought more of its own stock in the third quarter than the amount of its earnings. While all the big banks, with their share prices below book value, are keen on buybacks, regulators are reining them in "because stock repurchases eat into capital," writes David Henry of Reuters. Read more »
